00001 /**
00002  * @file   switch.c
00003  *
00004  * @date   2009-04-25
00005  * @author Jean-Lou Dupont
00006  *
00007  * \section Overview
00008  *
00009  *                      This source implements the *switch* function whereby *envelopes*
00010  *                      are presented, turn-wise, to each recipient(s) subscribing
00011  *                      to a particular *bus*.
00012  *
00013  */
00014 #include <stdlib.h>

00016 #include <errno.h>

00027 // Input Queue
00028 queue *_switch_queue;
00029 
00030 // Switch Thread
00031 pthread_t _switchThread;
00032 int _switchThread_status=0; //not created
00033 
00034 // Subscriptions to busses
00035 // -----------------------
00036 pthread_mutex_t _subscribers_mutex = PTHREAD_MUTEX_INITIALIZER;
00037 litm_connection *_subscribers[LITM_BUSSES_MAX][LITM_CONNECTION_MAX+1]; // index 0 is not used
00038 
00039 // "Signal"
00040 volatile int __switch_signal_shutdown = 0; // FALSE

00063         int
00064 switch_init(void) {
00065 
00066         if (0== _switchThread_status) {
00067 
00068 
00069                 // init queue *before* launching thread!
00070                 _switch_queue = queue_create();
00071                 __switch_init_tables();
00072 
00073                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_INFO, "switch_init: creating switch thread & queue, q[%x] ", _switch_queue);
00074 
00075                 pthread_create(&_switchThread, NULL, &__switch_thread_function, NULL);
00076                 _switchThread_status = 1; //created
00077         }
00078 }//
00079 
00080         void
00081 __switch_init_tables(void) {
00082         int b, c;
00083 
00084         for (b=0; b<LITM_BUSSES_MAX; b++)
00085                 for (c=0;c<=LITM_CONNECTION_MAX;c++)
00086                         _subscribers[b][c] = NULL;
00087 }
00088 
00089 /**
00090  * TODO implement switch shutdown
00091  */
00092         void
00093 switch_shutdown(void) {
00094 
00095         __switch_signal_shutdown = 1;
00096 
00097         pthread_join( _switchThread, (void **)NULL );
00098 }//

00101 /**
00102  * The switch thread dequeues messages from the
00103  *  ``input queue`` and dispatches them to the
00104  *  next connection queue.
00105  */
00106         void *
00107 __switch_thread_function(void *params) {
00108 
00109         char *err_msg;
00110         int pending, action;
00111         litm_code code;
00112         litm_envelope *e;
00113         litm_connection *next, *sender, *current;
00114         litm_bus bus_id;
00115         static char *thisMsg = "__switch_thread_function: conn[%x] code[%s]";
00116 
00117         DEBUG_LOG(LOG_INFO, "__switch_thread_function: starting");
00118 
00119         while(1) {
00120                 // we block here since if we have no messages
00121                 //  to process, we don't have anything else to do...
00122                 e=(litm_envelope *) queue_get_nb( _switch_queue );
00123 
00124                 if (NULL==e) {
00125 
00126                         //shutdown signaled?
00127                         if (1==__switch_signal_shutdown) {
00128                                 break;
00129                         }
00130 
00131                         continue;
00132                 }
00133 
00134                 //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_INFO, "__switch_thread_function: GOT ENVELOPE");
00135 
00136                 // The envelope contains the sender's connection ptr
00137                 //  as well as the ``current`` connection ptr.
00138 
00139                 // When the message is first sent on any bus,
00140                 //  the switch sets the ``current`` connection ptr
00141                 //  to the subscriber's connection ptr; this pointer
00142                 //  is obtained by scanning the ``subscription map``
00143                 //  for the first subscriber to the target bus.
00144 
00145                 // BUT FIRST, we need to know if the envelope
00146                 //  was already processed and just waiting to be
00147                 //  sent!
00148 
00149                 // message was processed and just sits pending
00150 
00151                 if (1==e->routes.pending) {
00152 
00153                         __switch_handle_pending(e);
00154                         continue; // <===================================================
00155 
00156                 }
00157 
00158                 // FROM THIS POINT, the envelope was pending
00159                 //  so we need to figured out where to send it next.
00160                 // NOTE: anything short of LITM_CODE_OK gets the
00161                 //       envelope finalized.  This behavior covers
00162                 //       the normal case where all recipients have
00163                 //       had the chance to glance over the message.
00164 
00165                 sender  = (e->routes).sender;
00166                 current = (e->routes).current;
00167                 bus_id  = (e->routes).bus_id;
00168 
00169                 //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_INFO, "__switch_thread_function: ENVELOPE NORMAL, bus[%u] sender[%x] current[%x] envelope[%x]", bus_id, sender, current, e);
00170 
00171 
00172                 code = __switch_get_next_subscriber(    &next,
00173                                                                                                 sender,
00174                                                                                                 current,
00175                                                                                                 bus_id);
00176 
00177                 switch(code) {
00178                 case LITM_CODE_OK:
00179                         break;
00180 
00181                 default:
00182                         err_msg = litm_translate_code(code);
00183                         DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "__switch_thread_function: ENVELOPE NORMAL... error[%s], finalize message", err_msg);
00184                         __switch_finalize(e);
00185                         continue; // <=======================================
00186                 }
00187 
00188 
00189                 // WE ARE GOOD TO GO
00190 
00191 
00192                 //adjust envelope
00193                 (e->routes).current = next;
00194 
00195                 code = __switch_try_sending_or_requeue( next, e );
00196                 err_msg = litm_translate_code(code);
00197 
00198                 switch(code) {
00199                 case LITM_CODE_OK:
00200                 case LITM_CODE_BUSY_OUTPUT_QUEUE:
00201                         DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, thisMsg, next, err_msg);
00202                         break;
00203 
00204                 default:
00205                         DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, thisMsg, next, err_msg);
00206                         __switch_finalize(e);
00207                         break;
00208                 }
00209 
00210 
00211         }//while
00212 
00213         DEBUG_LOG(LOG_INFO, "__switch_thread_function: ENDING");
00214 
00215         return NULL;
00216 }//END THREAD
00217 
00218 /**
00219  * Handle ``pending`` requests to sent
00220  */
00221         void
00222 __switch_handle_pending(litm_envelope *e) {
00223         DEBUG_LOG(LOG_INFO, "__switch_handle_pending: BEGIN");
00224 
00225         litm_connection *conn;
00226         litm_code code;
00227 
00228         conn = e->routes.current;
00229         code = __switch_try_sending_or_requeue( conn, e );
00230 
00231         // if the message was sent or requeued,
00232         //  we are ok but anything else means something
00233         //  went wrong (duh!) and since we are the owner
00234         //  of the envelope/message, we will "recover"
00235         //  by getting rid of the envelope+message.
00236         //  REASON:  the probable cause of errors
00237         //           stems from connection changes
00238         //           and this is not a normal usage pattern.
00239         static char *thisMsg = "__switch_handle_pending: conn[%x] code[%s]";
00240         char *translated_code = litm_translate_code(code);
00241 
00242         switch(code) {
00243 
00244         case LITM_CODE_OK:
00245         case LITM_CODE_BUSY_OUTPUT_QUEUE:
00246         case LITM_CODE_BUSY_CONNECTIONS:
00247         case LITM_CODE_ERROR_BAD_CONNECTION:
00248                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, thisMsg, conn, translated_code);
00249                 break;
00250 
00251         default:
00252                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, thisMsg, conn, translated_code);
00253                 __switch_finalize(e);
00254                 break;
00255         }//switch
00256 
00257 }//
00258 
00259 /**
00260  * A client has finished processing a message: send it
00261  *  through through the ``input_queue`` and if all intended
00262  *  recipients have processed it already, it will be finalized.
00263  *
00264  */
00265         litm_code
00266 switch_release(litm_connection *conn, litm_envelope *envlp) {
00267 
00268         if (NULL==conn) {
00269                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00270         }
00271         if (NULL==envlp) {
00272                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_INVALID_ENVELOPE;
00273         }
00274 
00275         DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "switch_release: conn[%x] envelope[%x]", conn, envlp );
00276 
00277         // if a message comes this way, it means a client
00278         // has finished processing it... get rid of the
00279         // "pending" state if at all present.
00280         (envlp->routes).pending = 0;
00281         envlp->released_count ++;
00282 
00283         int result = queue_put(_switch_queue, (void *) envlp);
00284         if (1 != result) {
00285                 __switch_finalize( envlp );
00286                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_MALLOC;
00287         }
00288 
00289         return LITM_CODE_OK;
00290 }//
00291 
00292 /**
00293  * Tries sending the envelope along BUT requeue if this is
00294  *  not possible at this juncture.
00295  *
00296  *  The call to __switch_try_sending_to_recipient is connection safe.
00297  *
00298  */
00299         litm_code
00300 __switch_try_sending_or_requeue(litm_connection *conn, litm_envelope *envlp) {
00301 
00302         if (NULL==envlp)
00303                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_INVALID_ENVELOPE;
00304 
00305         //int code = _litm_connections_trylock();
00306         //if (EBUSY==code)
00307         //      return LITM_CODE_BUSY_CONNECTIONS;
00308 
00309         //code = _litm_connection_validate_safe(conn);
00310         //if (1!=code) {
00311         //      _litm_connections_unlock();
00312         //      return LITM_CODE_ERROR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00313         //}
00314 
00315         litm_code result = __switch_try_sending_to_recipient(conn, envlp);
00316 
00317         if (LITM_CODE_BUSY_OUTPUT_QUEUE==result) {
00318 
00319                 (envlp->routes).pending = 1;
00320                 queue_put( _switch_queue, envlp );
00321         }
00322 
00323         //_litm_connections_unlock();
00324 
00325         return result;
00326 }//
00327 
00328 /**
00329  * Try sending the message to the recipient.
00330  *
00331  * This function does not block waiting for the recipient.
00332  * This function should only be called by ''__switch_try_sending_or_requeue''.
00333  */
00334         litm_code
00335 __switch_try_sending_to_recipient(      litm_connection *recipient,
00336                                                                         litm_envelope *env) {
00337 
00338         litm_code returnCode = LITM_CODE_OK;
00339         int code = 0;
00340 
00341         code = queue_put_nb( recipient->input_queue, (void *) env);
00342 
00343         switch(code) {
00344         case 0: //error
00345                 returnCode = LITM_CODE_ERROR_OUTPUT_QUEUING;
00346                 break;
00347         case 1: //success
00348                 env->delivery_count++;
00349                 break;
00350         case -1: //busy
00351                 returnCode = LITM_CODE_BUSY_OUTPUT_QUEUE;
00352                 break;
00353         }
00354 
00355         return returnCode;
00356 }//

00358 
00359         litm_code
00360 switch_add_subscriber(litm_connection *conn, litm_bus bus_id) {
00361 
00362         if (NULL==conn) {
00363                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00364         }
00365 
00366         if (( LITM_BUSSES_MAX < bus_id ) || (0>=bus_id)) {
00367                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_INVALID_BUS;
00368         }
00369 
00370         int code = pthread_mutex_trylock( &_subscribers_mutex );
00371         if (EBUSY==code)
00372                 return LITM_CODE_BUSY;
00373 
00374         code =_litm_connections_trylock();
00375         if (EBUSY==code)
00376                 return LITM_CODE_BUSY;
00377 
00378 
00379         int result=LITM_CODE_ERROR_BUS_FULL;
00380         int index;
00381         for (index=1; index<=LITM_CONNECTION_MAX; index++) {
00382                 if (NULL==_subscribers[bus_id][index]) {
00383                         _subscribers[bus_id][index] = conn;
00384                         result = LITM_CODE_OK;
00385                         break;
00386                 }
00387         }
00388 
00389         _litm_connections_unlock();
00390 
00391         pthread_mutex_unlock( &_subscribers_mutex );
00392 
00393         return result;
00394 }//
00395 
00396         litm_code
00397 switch_remove_subscriber(litm_connection *conn, litm_bus bus_id) {
00398 
00399         if (NULL==conn) {
00400                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00401         }
00402 
00403         if (( LITM_BUSSES_MAX < bus_id ) || (0>=bus_id)) {
00404                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_INVALID_BUS;
00405         }
00406 
00407         int code = pthread_mutex_trylock( &_subscribers_mutex );
00408         if (EBUSY==code)
00409                 return LITM_CODE_BUSY;
00410 
00411         code =_litm_connections_trylock();
00412         if (EBUSY==code)
00413                 return LITM_CODE_BUSY;
00414 
00415 
00416         int result=LITM_CODE_ERROR_SUBSCRIPTION_NOT_FOUND;
00417         int index;
00418         for (index=1; index<=LITM_CONNECTION_MAX; index++) {
00419                 if (conn==_subscribers[bus_id][index]) {
00420                         _subscribers[bus_id][index] = NULL;
00421                         result = LITM_CODE_OK;
00422                         break;
00423                 }
00424         }
00425 
00426         _litm_connections_unlock();
00427         pthread_mutex_unlock( &_subscribers_mutex );
00428 
00429         return result;
00430 }//
00431 
00432 /**
00433  * This function just queues up the message in the
00434  *  switch's input_queue without actually sending it
00435  *  to recipients.
00436  *
00437  *  This function blocks whilst accessing the switch's
00438  *  ``input_queue`` but no deadlock scenario is possible
00439  *  since the switch's thread does not block whilst dequeuing.
00440  *
00441  */
00442         litm_code
00443 switch_send(litm_connection *conn, litm_bus bus_id, void *msg,
00444                         void (*cleaner)(void *msg)) {
00445 
00446         if (NULL==conn) {
00447                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00448         }
00449 
00450         if (( LITM_BUSSES_MAX < bus_id ) || (0>=bus_id)) {
00451                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_INVALID_BUS;
00452         }
00453 
00454         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_INFO, "switch_send: BEGIN, conn[%x] bus[%u]", conn, bus_id);
00455 
00456         // Grab an envelope & init
00457         litm_envelope *e=__litm_pool_get();
00458         e->cleaner = cleaner;
00459         (e->routes).pending = 0; //FALSE
00460         (e->routes).bus_id = bus_id;
00461         (e->routes).sender = conn;
00462         (e->routes).current = NULL;  // First time sent
00463         e->msg = msg;
00464         e->delivery_count = 0;
00465 
00466         /*
00467          *  Initial message submission: if something goes
00468          *  wrong, we need to get rid of envelope.
00469          */
00470         int result = queue_put(_switch_queue, (void *) e);
00471         if (1 != result) {
00472                 __litm_pool_recycle( e );
00473                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_MALLOC;
00474         }
00475 
00476         return LITM_CODE_OK;
00477 }//
00478 
00479 
00480 /**
00481  * Finalizes a message
00482  *
00483  */
00484         litm_code
00485 __switch_finalize(litm_envelope *envlp) {
00486 
00487         if (NULL==envlp) {
00488                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_INVALID_ENVELOPE;
00489         }
00490 
00491         DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "__switch_finalize: envelope[%x]", envlp );
00492 
00493         void (*cleaner)(void *msg) = envlp->cleaner;
00494 
00495         if (NULL==cleaner) {
00496                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "__switch_finalize: envelope[%x] freeing", envlp );
00497 
00498                 free( envlp->msg );
00499         } else {
00500                 (*cleaner)( (void *) envlp->msg );
00501         }
00502 
00503         __litm_pool_recycle( envlp );
00504 
00505         return LITM_CODE_OK;
00506 }//
00507 
00508 
00509 /**
00510  * Scans the subscription map for the subscriber that
00511  * follows ``current``.  If ``current`` is NULL (thus
00512  * indicating the start of the scan), then pull the
00513  * first subscriber from the subscription to bus ``bus_id``.
00514  *
00515  * Furthermore, we are implementing ``split horizon``
00516  *  forwarding ie. don't send the message back to the
00517  *  originator.
00518  *
00519  * If end of list is reached, return NULL.
00520  *
00521  * CASES:
00522  * ======
00523  *
00524  * 1- empty subscription list
00525  * 2- single subscriber
00526  *    a) the sender
00527  *    b) other subscriber
00528  * 3- more than 1 subscriber
00529  *
00530  */
00531         litm_code
00532 __switch_get_next_subscriber(   litm_connection **result,
00533                                                                 litm_connection *sender,
00534                                                                 litm_connection *current,
00535                                                                 litm_bus bus_id) {
00536 
00537         litm_code returnCode = LITM_CODE_OK; //optimistic
00538 
00539         int index=1;
00540         int foundNext = 0;
00541         int foundFirst=0, bailOut=0; //FALSE
00542         litm_connection *c=NULL;
00543         *result = NULL; //precaution
00544 
00545         // this shouldn't happen...
00546         if (sender==current) {
00547                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_SWITCH_SENDER_EQUAL_CURRENT;
00548         }
00549 
00550         //int code = pthread_mutex_trylock( &_subscribers_mutex );
00551         //if (EBUSY==code)
00552         //      return LITM_CODE_BUSY;
00553 
00554                 //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "__switch_get_next_subscriber: BEGIN");
00555 
00556                 //_litm_connections_lock();
00557 
00558                         // FIND FIRST {{
00559                         if (NULL==current) {
00560                                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "__switch_get_next_subscriber: FIRST SEND");
00561 
00562                                 int searchResultIndex = 0;
00563                                 searchResultIndex = __switch_find_next_non_match(sender, bus_id);
00564 
00565                                 if (0!=searchResultIndex) {
00566                                         // non-null && non-sender
00567                                         foundFirst = searchResultIndex;
00568                                 } else {
00569                                         // first time the message is sent... but no subscribers
00570                                         // it would appear...
00571                                         returnCode = LITM_CODE_ERROR_SWITCH_NEXT_NOT_FOUND;
00572                                         bailOut = 1;
00573                                 }
00574                         }//if
00575                         // }}
00576 
00577                         if (0!=foundFirst) {
00578                                 // we found the first recipient
00579                                 // bail out with the result!
00580                                 *result = _subscribers[bus_id][foundFirst];
00581                                 bailOut=1;
00582                                 returnCode = LITM_CODE_OK;
00583                         }
00584 
00585                         // at this point, we are looking for the recipient
00586                         // after ``current`` but that isn't ``sender`` nor NULL
00587                         if (1!=bailOut) {
00588                                 int foundMatch = __switch_find_match(current, bus_id);
00589 
00590                                 if (0==foundMatch) {
00591                                         // can't find ``current``...
00592                                         // maybe the connection was pull-off from our feet
00593                                         returnCode = LITM_CODE_ERROR_SWITCH_NO_CURRENT;
00594                                         bailOut = 1;
00595                                 } else {
00596                                         // we found ``current``...
00597                                         // need the following subscriber
00598                                         // without forgetting about split-horizon!
00599                                         for ( index=foundMatch+1; index<=LITM_CONNECTION_MAX; index++) {
00600                                                 c = _subscribers[bus_id][index];
00601                                                 if ((NULL!=c) && (sender!=c)) {
00602                                                         foundNext = index;
00603                                                         *result = c;
00604                                                         returnCode = LITM_CODE_OK;
00605                                                         break;
00606                                                 }
00607                                         }//for
00608 
00609                                         if (0==foundNext)
00610                                                 returnCode = LITM_CODE_ERROR_SWITCH_NEXT_NOT_FOUND;
00611 
00612                                 }//foundMatch
00613                         }//bailOut
00614 
00615                 //_litm_connections_unlock();
00616 
00617         //pthread_mutex_unlock( &_subscribers_mutex );
00618 
00619         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "__switch_get_next_subscriber: END");
00620 
00621         return returnCode;
00622 }//
00623 
00624 /**
00625  * Find the next ``non-match`` and non-NULL
00626  *
00627  * THIS FUNCTION IS NOT *CONNECTION SAFE*
00628  */
00629         int
00630 __switch_find_next_non_match(litm_connection *ref, litm_bus bus_id) {
00631 
00632         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "__switch_find_next_non_match: BEGIN, ref[%x] bus[%u]", ref, bus_id);
00633 
00634         int index, result = 0;
00635         litm_connection *current;
00636 
00637         for (index=1; index<=LITM_CONNECTION_MAX; index++) {
00638 
00639                 current=_subscribers[bus_id][index];
00640                 if ((current!=ref) && (current!=NULL)) {
00641                         result = index;
00642                         break;
00643                 }
00644         }
00645 
00646         DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "__switch_find_next_non_match: END, ref[%x] bus[%u] result[%u]", ref, bus_id, result);
00647 
00648         return result;
00649 }//
00650 
00651 /**
00652  * Find ``match``
00653  *
00654  * THIS FUNCTION IS NOT *CONNECTION SAFE* and
00655  *  thus must be called whilst holding the _connections lock.
00656  *
00657  */
00658         int
00659 __switch_find_match(litm_connection *ref, litm_bus bus_id) {
00660 
00661         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "__switch_find_match: BEGIN");
00662 
00663         int index, result = 0;
00664         litm_connection *current;
00665 
00666         for (index=1; index<=LITM_CONNECTION_MAX; index++) {
00667 
00668                 current=_subscribers[bus_id][index];
00669                 if ((current==ref) && (current!=NULL)) {
00670                         result = index;
00671                         break;
00672                 }
00673         }
00674 
00675         DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "__switch_find_match: END, ref[%x] bus[%u] result[%u]", ref, bus_id, result);
00676 
00677         return result;
00678 }//
